did.abstract: Teacher, writer, member of feminist organizations. Materials relating to her involvement with the University of Michigan Commission for Women, Ann Arbor Focus on Equal Opportunity for Women, PROBE into the Status of Women at The University of Michigan, and the Ad Hoc Committee Concerned That President Fleming Does Not Meet With Women.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Jeanne Tashian (donor no. 6379).

accruals.p: No furtehr additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Jeanne Tashian papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Jeanne Tashian was co-editor of the newsletter of the University of Michigan Commission for Women. She began as a secretary, then as editorial assistant and eventually co-editor of the Women's Information Network Bulletin. Tashian was also an active member of Ann Arbor Focus on Equal Opportunity for Women and founding member of PROBE into the Status of Women at the University of Michigan. She served as general coordinator of the Ad Hoc Committee Concerned That President Fleming Does Not Meet With Women. Other activities included being student representative on the University's Doctor of Arts Admissions Committee. She was also instrumental in developing the job of women's advocate with the University Office of Student Organizations and in the attempt to organize clerical workers at the University of Michigan into a union.

scopecontent.p: The papers of Jeanne Tashian, 1970-1976, primarily relate to the feminist movement in Ann Arbor and at the University of Michigan between 1970 and 1973. Most of the files relate to her various organizational interests and activities.
